title: The incredible design of the ISS
description: A super interesting video about the ISS by Fern.

title: What is the future of art?
description: A look at different opinions about AI art and the broader definition of art.

title: The ‚ÄúMac vs PC‚Äù era of AI
description: An interesting take on the two paths of AI development: the agents and the personal apps.

title: Liquid Glass
description: A video addressing the alleged accessibility issues of the upcoming iOS 26 update. It clearly defines the philosophy of this new design language. We've reached a point where this design process is closer to a physical approach than a software one.

title: The Objects of Our Life
description: Steve's talk at the 1983 International Design Conference in Aspen. He explains what a computer is, how software works, and what the next decades of advancements could look like, all with incredible foresight.

title: Automated Cleaning
description: A very important breakthrough: cleaning robots. Hygiene is what leads to healthier and longer living societies.

title: Vulcan robots: the next genreration warehouse
description: In addition to the real time vision systems, those robots can feel the environment arount them using sensors and tactile feedback. This is a huge step and allow the robots to grab stuff more efficiently without damaging them.

title: A new way to film widelife
description: The BBC used robots looking like dung heaps to film close up shots of wild animals without scaring them away. This is a funny outcome of the recent advancements in robotics!

title: Bill Gates' 1993 prediction for the future of computers
description: Bill Gates and Paul Allen launched computing giant Microsoft 50 years ago. In 1993, he talked to the BBC about the online innovations that would define the 21st Century. He was truly a visionary.

title: Beyond Human Training
description: Google DeepMind's new ‚ÄúStreams‚Äù AI learns directly from the real world, discarding human data all by itself. This means the AI can come up with ideas that people might never have imagined or fully understood.

title: Google's advantage
description: Google decided to lean heavily towards TPU instead of GPU for their AI infrastructure. This is a bold move that will allow them to have a more efficient and powerful system in the long run. You could comapare that with Apple's M1 chip, which was a game changer for the company. Google won't have to rely on Nvidia at all for example.

title: The design of mechanical characters
description: In 2013, Disney published a paper on the design of mechanical characters. It's basically an interactive design system that lets anyone (even without engineering experience) turn a digital, articulated character into a 3-D-printable mechanical toy/figure. It works for a wide range of characters and movements, from simple 2D to complex 3D animations.

title: Nice graphic design with the help of GPT Image Gen
UI Design Trends In 2025
description: Interesting article.

title: Fibonacci in design
description: Saying bye to 4px spacing and hello to Fibonacci. Very useful article about spacing in web design.

title: Open-source Icons
description: Free, open-source and consistent. I use those icons in most of my projects.

title: Font pairing made easy
description: Fontjoy is a tool that helps you find 3 complementary fonts that work well together. It uses a neural network and is very fun to play with.

title: Open-source figma alternative
description: Penpot is a free and open-source design and prototyping platform. It is a great alternative to Figma!

title: freemediaheckyeah
description: The largest collection of free stuff on the internet!

title: Color and font visualizer
description: Realtime Colors is a tool that lets you visualize the colors and fonts used on a dummy website in real-time. It is very useful for designers wanting to know if colors work and check for accessibility. It allows you to setup a light and dark mode, and then export the css.

title: When Your Body Attacks Itself
description: Autoimmunity. What happens when your immune system, designed to protect you, turns against you? And why does this happen?

title: Cleo Abram
description: Video journalist behind the show 'Huge If True', delivering optimistic and beautifully produced science & tech explainers.

title: Ramanujan the Math Genius
description: An overview of Ramanujan's life and contributions to mathematics. He truly was a genius with incredible talent and intuition.

title: One of the biggest breakthroughs in AI
description: OpenAI's o1 model was a huge deal: it introduced the notion of "reasoning", which is a fundamental step towards general intelligence. The model was the first to be able to solve bigger problems, step by step. This was truely a game changer.

title: Kim "Chubby" Isenberg
description: One of the most insightful thinkers about AI and the future on X. His posts are always worth reading. His newsletter is also very good.

title: You're More Stressed Than Ever - Let's Change That
description: What exactly is stress, how did it evolve, and is it even possible to use it in a healthy way? This is a great video to learn more about stress, I highly recommend it.

title: Anthropic's Project Vend
description: Project Vend consisted in letting Claude Sonnet run a small shop by itself. The goal was to better understand how AI agents can interact with the real world and what were the biggest limitations.

title: AI in the job industry
description: This paper shows that AI has high applicability across a wide range of jobs. Each career field is given a score from 0 to 1, 1 being the most easily automatable with current AI systems.

title: This is more than an Ad
description: This is truely one of the best car ad I've ever seen. The motion graphic work is incredible, sound design is on point. Watch it, you'll be surprised.

title: Tesla full self-driving (FSD) is magic
description: In the clip shared in this X post, FSD uses a drivethru and understands the complex scenario and socia interactions perfectly. It knows when to stop, when to go. This is truly impressive. Tesla achieved this with camera vision only and a well trained neural network. No lidar required.

title: AI's impact on vehicle safety
description: AI's impact can be huge is some domains, very specifically in vehicle safety. Tesla's data shows that vehicles with FSD engaged are involved in significantly fewer accidents than those without (7 times less!). The more we wait before adopting that tech, the more lives we put at risk.

title: Can robots feel?
description: Creating an artificial electronic skin to cover the entire surface of a robot can be challenging. This article explores how robots could feel by only exploiting a few internal sensors on each limb/joint. Those sensors would measure the force/torque applied to them, and compute the exact contact points causing those forces. It even works when the robot gets touched in multiple places at the same time!

title: Apple's handcrafted AppleTV intro

meta.text: Link to an article on MacRumors

description: In a time of AI generated content flooding the internet, Apple decided to create its new AppleTV intro sequence using only real camera footage. Everything was made by hand, using pure craftsmanship. Watch this video to see their creative process.

title: Robots integrated in BMW's production line
description: BMW is using Figure AI's robots in their production line to assist human workers. They contributed to the production of over 30,000 cars. This as a sign robots are becoming more and more useful in real world applications.

title: Art vs Technology
description:
"@technology always finds the next reproducible thing

art always finds the next irreproducible thing" - Kepano. This is very well said and true. I believe that any good products will always need to have both elements combined together: art and technology.

title: Graphic design trends in 2026
description: I believe that those trends mentioned here could be very accurate. Let's see how many of them will actually happen! Even if you just take a quick look at this article, you'll get some nice inspiration.
